intro: Podolepis jaceoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact clusters. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its spread across open habitats. Podolepis jaceoides is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
